titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of John J. Contreni, 2015, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Ava Dickerson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:32:37 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Contreni, John J. mss., 2015, consist of a typescript and printed issue containing Contreni's article "'A Story that Can't be Printed'" about the final ceremony held at the burial of Ernie Pyle on Ie Shima.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John J. Contreni is a professor of history at Purdue University. His research interests include early medieval cultures with an emphasis on the manuscripts and schools of Carolingian Europe.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a 4 page typescript by John J. Contreni of "'A Story that Can't be Printed': Ernie Pyle's Ie Shima Memorial Dedication, Dealing with Men, and Military Journalism in the Mid-Pacific During World War II" about the final ceremony held at the burial of Ernie Pyle on Ie Shima, July 2, 1945. Also includes Indiana Magazine of History, Vol. 111, No. 3, which contains Contreni's article.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Contreni, John J. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See Pyle mss., Pyle mss. II, Pyle mss. III, Pyle mss. IV, Pyle mss. V, Pyle mss. VI, and Pyle mss. VII, also located at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
